case_vignette: A 14-year-old male with no pertinent past medical history presents with a painless growing black spot on his left hand and arm! States he thinks it may have occured after working with farm animals including pigs, sheep, and cattle on his parents farm! Parents states it began as a yellow pus spot that slowly enlargened and popped with yellow fluid exiting! Review of symptoms remarkable for new shortness of breath and otherwise negative! Examination revealed an edematous pink-brown violaceous plaques with central necrotic escharsand surrounding erythema on the left hand and arm! Punch biopsy is performed and demonstrates gram positive spore-forming rods!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painless growing black spot on my left hand and arm and I've also been experiencing some new shortness of breath.
How long have you noticed the black spot and when did the shortness of breath start?
The black spot started as a yellow pus spot that enlarged and popped, and I've recently started experiencing shortness of breath.
Do you have any history of cancer or serious illnesses in your family?
No, I don't have any pertinent past medical history.
Have you been exposed to substances like tar, oil, or arsenic, or undergone radiation therapy?
No, but I have been working with farm animals including pigs, sheep, and cattle on my parents' farm.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, joint pain, or additional skin changes elsewhere on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any other symptoms apart from the shortness of breath.
Final Diagnosis: Anthrax
